title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Facebook filed a motion seeking the dismissal of an amended FTC antitrust lawsuit alleging that the company engaged in unlawful monopolization.

Major U.S. stock indexes posted declines, with the Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow retreating 2.1%, 1.3% and 0.9%, respectively.

China Evergrande's property-management unit said it could be the subject of a takeover bid, a deal that could bring in much-needed cash for its parent company.

Sen. Warren asked the SEC to investigate whether personal financial investments by senior Fed officials, including Vice Chairman Clarida, violated insider-trading rules.

Tesla subjected a Black former worker to a racially hostile work environment and failed to take reasonable steps to prevent him from being harassed, a federal jury found.

Kelly Campbell, the president of Walt Disney's Hulu streaming platform, has resigned and is in talks to take a senior role at Comcast's NBCUniversal.

What's News: Business & Finance
